name: NotTheNameWeWanted
description: Not The Name We Wanted is the ruthless Snake-like parody of that infamous driving game set in the UK. Join us on a shonky hand-drawn voyage across Britain’s green and pleasant lands. Play as Daffyd, Darren and British PM David Cameron in this satirical cult-hit game. Not for the easily offended.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7 or 8 Processor: 1.5 Ghz Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 200 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Amazing game.  Does not require Rockstar Social Club  10/10
can confirm, it's not GTA V
When you can't afford GTA V this is the next best option.. WORTH.  Jacket potato for life!
satirical parody of snake - addictive gameplay- funny at times - 100% profits go to charity - no brainer - ;D
Can't take it anymore.
Cant wait until the newest heist dlc comes out.   10/10 would do it with a prostisheep again.
Brief & whimsical // Recommended for brief jaunts of a decidedly silly nature

Pros: + Silky Smooth 200 FPS on any system, displaying Not Games' knowledge of backward compatibility + Game developers don't shill you out of your hard earned dollah by cutting parts from the game and relabeling it as 'DLC' + Able to play as David Cameron + Game displays a very strong grasp of political knowledge + Able to play as a Chav + Game shows representation by letting you play as a poor person + Play as a Welshman + Game shows representation by letting you play as a sheep fu-- I mean, a furry. +Able to run over hippies +Able to run over other chavs +Able to run over whiney liberals + Able to crash into Big Ben + over 200 hours of gameplay + Cheap price  Cons: - Cannot play as Nigel Farage - Cannot explore Scotland  9.9/10 game of the century
Hilarious parody.
NotGTAV is snake, but not GTA V.
I gifted this to a friend.... we're not friends anymore.                     also the save feauture doesn't work for some reason.

Its okay. --- only game that can remove your achievements when you fail a level and also only game where you can get more than 10 achievements in one minute (suck it COD) and also only game you wont regret buying at all. ---- +its hardcore +it comes with classic Snake game - ++value of this game just for playing that on steam
Better graphics than GTA V         YouTube™ Video:  NotGTAV | BEST GTA GAME EVER

It's probably not the best game out there but it does make you come back to that old Snake-like gameplay that, at some point of our gaming life, everyone enjoyed. That plus mocking of various things of british culture, and of course of GTA V. The money you'll pay for this game will go (100%) to charity, so that's another plus. The game itself is fun for about an hour or two, but no more than that. And just a warning, it is not GTA V. It's Snake plus GTA V plus mocking of everything in general, and it's outcome is as bad as I expected. So try it out and, as you you do so, you'll be 'donating' your money to charity as well!
It's like Snake with Guns. 420/69 gr8 b8 m8.
Best game of the year.

The title doesn't lie.

To be honest, through all my playtime of this game I noticed how inferior the actual GTAV was to this masterpiece. Firstly, this game is extremely cheap compared to the still expensive GTAV. I can even buy copies of this game for all my friends and it would only cost a fraction of the actual GTAV. Secondly, this game is extremely accessible to all computers unlike GTAV with its high PC standards to not have your eyes burn. Thirdly and lastly, NotGTAV shares all other aspects of GTAV such as the nudity, gore, police chases, story, etc. In the end, I realized that I wasted money on the actual GTAV when I could have got this game for far much cheaper and with more playablility. Thank you NotGames for bringing all this enjoyment!
It's British, It's hilarious, so many GTA references, it may be only a game of snake, but totally worth every cent!

One of the best Indie titles I've played in a while. It really captures the essence of GTA V, but it isn't GTA V. If you are looking for a great, cheap alternative to GTA V without multiplayer, and real-time action combat. Then Not GTAV is for you. The story of Not GTAV is amazing. You are constantly in the action, running ♥♥♥♥ over with a tractor, cart, or car. I really feel like I am a part of the story and I become deeply emmerssed in the gameplay. Whenever I am looking to unwind and have some fun, I always find myself gravitating towards this amazing title.  The gameplay is smooth and highly optimized for PC. The controls work perfectly with no delay at all. The voice acting and music is what really takes the cake though, the time that went in to composing and performing the music in this masterpiece is astonishing.  Overall I rate this game an 8/10. 9/10 for gameplay 7/10 for story

Probably the best game ive played in a LONG time. If you have the money or chance you HAVE to pick this up, it is better then GTA V in everyway, shape and form. I didn't think much of this game at first but as time went on it grew on me, I don't know wether it was the next generation graphics or the great sound production but it all blends together perfectly. All that is left to say is, This game is a MUST buy.

What GTAV should of been   10/10

This game is absolutely gold. The story is such well tailored and immersive. Starting with the story of Dafydd, a middle class trailer guy in Wales, trying to drive off the obnoxious and 'sophisticated' campers from London by doing breath taking heists like the 'Bar Soap' heist. The masterminds behind NotGTAV didn't stop there, they even made TWO more characters with such eloquent stories they cannot simply be described as one on this review. Don't forget the musical masterpieces crafted by the amazing creators of NotGTAV. All in all, this game is just absolutely fantastic. I cannot imagine how the creators of NotGTAV were able to shape this beautiful creation. 11/10.

10/10 MLG SNAKE  In all honestly im actually surprised by this game as it seems to outplay R*'s GTAV in every way. Vehicles have better steering and physics, shooting is much more realistic and i also like the selective radio choice which i has to say is simply outstanding.  Already Finished the game in a whopping 1 hour. Would recommend to buy best 40p ive spent so far on steam, has a very MLG ending which i wont ruin for anyone but it has a 10/10 cutscene.  NotGTAV2 confirmed????????????  EDIT: Alright 3 hours in and im still alive, only have half a keyboard after trying the game on dark souls difficultly due to me faceplanting my desk one to many a time. I shall keep going though, if i dont return then tell GABEN i love him.

It's definitely correct. NotGTAV is not GTAV.  It's not the greatest looking game, nor the most polished, nor the most imaginative. But, it is, to the Brits, very funny, and killing David Cameron in a Snake clone is something I never knew I needed to witness until now, but it was great.  Also, you know, all profits go to charity.  If you understand Britsh humour and are able to laugh at the game whilst playing it (and willing to donate to charity), get this game.
Here's a video of me playing this game it shows you how much I enjoyed it and I will play it again.         YouTube™ Video:  NotGTAV - Gameplay (It's on sale until Monday on steam!)

As a gentleman from the isles of the United Kingdom, this game really does feel like an average day in my life. The game really does replicate a day in the life of your average Welshman/Chav/Tosspot Politician. Pip Pip Cheerio/10 I say, bring on NotGTAVI!

Love it for the game and the cause. Plus it is just flat out brash. The music is funny and the title is very accurate. This game is the complete opposite of gta 5 in that the graphics and gameplay are is stripped down as they get (scribbly crayon sprites i tell you) but is a fun game all the same. For the most part it is a snake clone but made considerably less boring with a wicked european wit and a love of obscenity. The low profile nature and short levels are perfect for old computers or to run on a sexond monitor while doing more important things like working or googling this games weird refrences. Looking forward to seeing more from the peoples at NotGames.

Overall: 0.75 / 10  NotGTAV is one of those titles that you would be drawn to just because of the title, expecting the game to be funny. However, nearly instantly upon starting the game you realize it has nothing to offer. Humour is so poorly executed to the point where I wonder if other raters were payed off to kick this game up to 'Very positive'. Only positive thing about it is that it claims that all of the profits are going to charity, which honestly I feel it should be no other way at all. However, just choose a charity and donate money directly. Skip this title.  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Graphics: 2 / 10 Poor, choppy graphics. Art at the level of elementary grader.   Sounds: 1 / 10 Often confusing and poorly optimised sound containing not really original or funny jokes. often just random noises and gibberish.  Controls: 0 / 10 Game does not utilize mouse controls at all, suggesting really poor, begginer level programming. Controls themself consist of pressing movement keys to move the snake in a tile-per-tile pattern.  Gameplay: 0 / 10 Game itself is only about 20 minutes long and at the same time very repeatative. Nothing than the few icons changes (you are either a car, or a cart).  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  P.S. for developers. + From the game and appearance of the same on steam I understand that the developers realize most of these things already. A project game that used the GTAV hype to get on steam but in reality has not much to offer takes all the profits to charity. That is a nice gesture that I do support.  All developers (including myself), have started low, with similar projects that try to make the learning curve more fun for themself and I support this. You gathered experience in programming, art style, working with steam and with people. However, when it comes to my rating of the game, please also have in mind that these are intended as a quality check for a market. Only objective thoughts on the game. Best wishes for the future!
(Got the game as a gift) ♥♥♥♥ presented as satire is still ♥♥♥♥ guys.

I hated every moment I played this game.  To start off with, this game is meant to be primarily humorous, if you buy this game, it's because it's going to be something that amuses you and makes you laugh. However, if your sense of humor is anything like mine, then you're not going to laugh, and all you're left with is a tedious, badly designed game.  It plays like snake. You know the one, the old atari snake, where you're moving on a 4 directional plane with a tail behind you. If you've played snake, you've played this game, only I prefer snake. There are obstacles to avoid, and different events which all play out the same way every time across all three 'campaigns', only increasingly difficult.  It has so little to do with GTAV that it's kind of skeevy how they used its likeness to get attention and purchases. The only aspects of this game in common with GTAV is you play as 3 seperate characters, the word 'heist' is shoehorned in, and.. that's it really.   The humor is largely political and social, and I'm under the assumption that the political humor is largely related to a specific event and person over in the UK, so if you're an American like me, or really any other place that isn't the UK or you're not versed on world politics, you're not going to get those jokes.  The social humor is predictable and dumb.   Every campaign goes the same way... you run some things over, then the next phase is running away from something, then you run over something specific, then theres another phase of running away from something, then there's a 'heist' where you go top down over the chracter within a room and grab items of some kind while either avoiding or slaughtering the other people in the room depending on if you took the Stealthy or Brutal route. This process is only made slightly harder across the other campaigns, but its mostly just reskinned.   There's also some hardcore mode difficulty which I haven't and am unlikely to ever play.  The art style I think is supposed to be quirky or deliberately trashy looking, but it ends up just coming off as lazy. The crayon drawing equivalent art and scanned handrawn work patched together into vague animation does not appeal to me, and I grew quickly tired of looking at it.  The voice acting is maybe decent on its own, but the dialogue I found to be wretched. It's also repeated.. constantly. Constantly you will hear the same f**king dialogue spouted, and it gets so old so fast that at certain points I had to take off my headset.   All in all, if this games style of humor appeals to you, it's worth the 74 cents my friend paid for it. But if you don't like the jokes, then there's nothing about this game that is worth the money.   Recommended if you like the humor. Not recommended if you don't.

I really enjoy the parody aspect and humor of the game. The graphics are also charming as it looks like everything was make in paint. It actually might have been as well. But for 3 dollars it's really just a snake clone. You end up doing the same thing all the time and I got bored of it after 20 minutes. Wait for a sale to get a few laughs. 2 out of 5 Matt faces.
